scenario:
S&P Global reported strong Q4 2024 earnings, surpassing market expectations with robust growth in its Ratings segment. Key financial metrics include:

- Adjusted EPS of $3.77, beating estimates by 8.6%
- Revenue of $3.592 billion, exceeding expectations by 2.5% and growing 14% year-over-year
- Adjusted operating margin of 46.7%, a 2.6% point increase from Q4 2023
- Net income of $880 million, a 52% increase from Q4 2023

Segmental performance highlights include:
- Ratings segment revenue growth of 27%
- Market Intelligence unit revenue growth of 5%
- Commodity Insights segment revenue growth of 10%
- Indices revenue growth of 21%, driven by asset-linked fees from ETFs and mutual funds

For 2025, S&P Global forecasts revenue growth of 5.0% to 7.0% and a GAAP diluted EPS range of $14.20 to $14.45. Adjusted EPS is expected to be between $17.00 and $17.25. The company aims to capitalize on growth opportunities in emerging markets and ESG offerings, while maintaining its competitive edge through continuous investment in data and technological enhancements. S&P Global also plans to return 85% or more of its adjusted free cash flow to shareholders.
